body.p: This policy gives an overview of device access control security principles and responsibilities within the . It provides a summary of the policies and guides that apply to device access management.
To help identify formal policy statements, each is prefixed with an identifier of the form: POLDACPxxx, where xxx is a unique ID number.
body.note: For the purposes of this policy, "network" or "networks" refers to protected networks.

body.p:
This policy aligns to industry standards and frameworks, and is divided into three security categories (and subsections describing the controls) addressing:
Business Requirements of Device Access Controls.
Relevant Device Controls.
Device Access Control Management.

Identification, Authentication, Authorisation, and Accounting (IAAA) are the core principles of an Access Control Policy. The principles apply to all security categories described in this policy, as follows:
Identification POLDACP001: Devices provide a unique ID that is presented on access to networks.
Authentication POLDACP002: To access networks, devices be authenticated.
Authorisation POLDACP003: Specifying access rights to devices be in accordance with the Device Access Provisioning guidance.
Accounting POLDACP004: Successful and unsuccessful device attempts to access networks be recorded in logs.

topic.title: Business Requirements of Device Access Control

body.p: The 's business or strategic requirements are to control, limit, and manage access to networks as described in the following subsections.

POLDACP005: This device access control policy be established and maintained, based on business and information security requirements, to inform associated standards, configurations, and guidance, for all devices.

POLDACP006: The policy also follow the additional principles of:
"Need-to-know".
Least privilege.
Device Access Control.

This subsection aligns to the principle of least access, to protect a network which is covered in other areas of this policy, specifically:
Authorisation procedures for showing which device is allowed to access which network.
Management controls and procedures to prevent access and provision of real-time monitoring.
POLDACP007: The strive to prevent unauthorised access by devices to networks, as described in the following subsections.
POLDACP008: Where required by the access control policy, device access to networks be controlled by a secure device authentication procedure.
POLDACP009: Multiple devices share the same authentication certificate.
POLDACP010: Device credentials expire after a period of time.
POLDACP011: The maximum allowable lifetime for a device certificate be defined.
POLDACP012: If credentials expire or are revoked, access be disallowed until new credentials are obtained.By exception, a device be allowed to connect in order to renew credentials.
Device access management ensures authorised device access and prevents unauthorised access to networks. These are described in the following subsections.
POLDACP013: A formal device registration and de-registration process be implemented to enable device access.
POLDACP014: A formal device access provisioning process be implemented to assign or revoke access rights for all devices to all networks.

Specifically, for the , this includes:
POLDACP015: All network access employ adequate authentication techniques to identify the connecting device with confidence, where that device requires access to networks. Refer to the Authentication guidance.
POLDACP016: Administrators maintain the device access service, with failure to manage successfully leading to potential compromise of the network.Administrators consist of all those involved in the provision of the device, or network services and capabilities, including third parties contracted to the such as Service Providers.
POLDACP017: Administrators maintain an active list of all active and suspended devices, and maintain their access control to networks.
POLDACP018: Access provisioning be implemented, adjusted, and revoked as described in associated Device Provisioning Guides for each class of network subject to access control under this Policy.
POLDACP019: The allocation of certificates be controlled through a formal management process.

topic.title: Removal or Adjustment of Device Access Rights

body.p: The removal or adjustment of device access rights is covered in this policy under Device Access Provisioning.
